main event: A large, teardrop-shaped object with a blue nose, yellow midsection, and red tail was observed from the Greek vessel M.S. Themistocles on April 25, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared to have a fiery look with yellow sparks trailing behind it., The observation was made at approximately 2315Z on the day of the sighting., The sighting lasted only 1 second according to the report., A seaplane was spotted in the area 15 minutes prior to the sighting of the UFO., The report did not classify the sighting as a balloon, satellite, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon, leaving it as insufficient data for evaluation.
sighted object: teardrop-shaped object with blue nose, yellow midsection, and red tail
witness description: Officer and radio operator aboard the Greek vessel M/S Themistocles
